javax.jaxtx.acid
Interface ACIDTransactionManager

public interface ACIDTransactionManager

This is the service side component of the user interface. Since services or some entity acting on their behalf (e.g., an interceptor) must enlist participants with the transaction, this interface primarily concentrates on those methods. However, a service may well not be the final destination for a transaction, i.e., in order to perform its work, the service may have to make other remote invocations on other services and propagate the context, suspend it, etc. As such, all of the UserTransaction methods are also available to the service.

Version:
$Id: ACIDTransactionManager.java,v 1.1 2004/06/22 10:07:55 nmcl Exp $

Method Detail

begin

public void begin()
           throws WrongStateException,
                  NotSupportedException,
                  SystemException
Start a new transaction. If there is already a transaction associated with the thread then it will be nested, if supported. A timeout period may be associated with the transaction, such that if it has not terminated prior to the timeout elapsing, it will automatically be rolled back. The timeout is set via the setTimeout method and is associated with the invoking thread, i.e., each thread may have it's own notion of timeout values for transactions it creates.

Throws:
WrongStateException - Thrown if the any currently associated transaction is in a state that does not allow a new transaction to be enlisted.
NotSupportedException - Thrown if nested transactions are not supported.
SystemException - Thrown in any other situation.

commit

public void commit()
            throws InvalidTransactionException,
                   WrongStateException,
                   HeuristicHazardException,
                   HeuristicMixedException,
                   SystemException,
                   NoTransactionException,
                   TransactionRolledBackException
Commit the transaction. All participants that are still enlisted with the transaction are committed.

Throws:
InvalidTransactionException - Thrown if the current transaction is not known about by the transaction system.
WrongStateException - Thrown if the current transaction is not in a state that allows commit to be called.
HeuristicHazardException - Thrown if the participants generated a hazard heuristic.
HeuristicMixedException - Thrown if the participants generated a mixed heuristic.
NoTransactionException - Thrown if there is no transaction associated with the invoking thread.
SystemException - Thrown if some other error occurred.
TransactionRolledBackException

rollback

public void rollback()
              throws InvalidTransactionException,
                     WrongStateException,
                     HeuristicHazardException,
                     HeuristicMixedException,
                     SystemException,
                     NoTransactionException,
                     TransactionCommittedException
Abort the transaction. All participants that are still enlisted with the transaction are rolled back.

Throws:
InvalidTransactionException - Thrown if the current transaction is not known about by the transaction system.
WrongStateException - Thrown if the current transaction is not in a state that allows cancel to be called.
HeuristicHazardException - Thrown if the participants generated a hazard heuristic.
HeuristicMixedException - Thrown if the participants generated a mixed heuristic.
NoTransactionException - Thrown if there is no transaction associated with the invoking thread.
SystemException - Thrown if some other error occurred.
TransactionCommittedException

status

public int status()
           throws NoTransactionException,
                  SystemException
Returns:
the status of the current transaction.
Throws:
NoTransactionException - Thrown if there is no transaction associated with the calling thread.
SystemException - Thrown if any error occurs.
See Also:
Status

suspend

public ACIDTransaction suspend()
                        throws SystemException
Suspend all transactions associated with this thread. The thread then becomes associated with no transaction.

Returns:
a representation of the context associated with the thread, or null if there is no context.
Throws:
SystemException - if any error occurs.
See Also:
ACIDTransaction

resume

public void resume(ACIDTransaction tx)
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                   InvalidTransactionException,
                   SystemException
Associate this thread with the specified context. Any current associations are lost.

Throws:
InvalidTransactionException - Thrown if the context is invalid.
SystemException - Thrown if any other error occurs.
java.lang.IllegalStateException

currentTransaction

public ACIDTransaction currentTransaction()
                                   throws SystemException
Returns:
a representation of the context currently associated with the invoking thread, or null if there is none. This operation does not suspend the transaction from the thread, unlike suspend.
Throws:
SystemException - Thrown if any other error occurs.

setRollbackOnly

public void setRollbackOnly()
                     throws NoTransactionException,
                            WrongStateException,
                            SystemException
Set the state of the transaction such that the only possible outcome is for it to rollback.

Throws:
NoTransactionException - Thrown if there is no transaction associated with the current thread.
WrongStateException - Thrown if the state of the transaction is such that it is not possible to put it into a rollback-only state, e.g., it is committing.
SystemException - Thrown if any other error occurs.

getTimeout

public int getTimeout()
               throws SystemException
Get the timeout value currently associated with the thread. This will be the timeout associated with any transactions created by this thread. However, it may not be the timeout associated with previously created transactions.

Returns:
the timeout value in seconds, or 0 if no application specified timeout has been provided.
Throws:
SystemException - Thrown if any error occurs.

setTimeout

public void setTimeout(int timeout)
                throws SystemException
Set the timeout to be associated with all subsequently created transactions. A default value of 0 is automatically associated with each thread and this means that no application specified timeout is set for activities, i.e., it is implementation dependant.

Throws:
SystemException - Thrown if any error occurs.
